item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, April 29, 2025 at 1:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. LibreLingo – FOSS Alternative to Duolingo (390 points | 164 comments)
2. Show HN: A Chrome extension that will auto-reject non-essential cookies (38 points | 15 comments)
3. Japan unveils first solar super-panel (28 points | 14 comments)
4. Show HN: Memex is a Claude Code alternative built on Rust+Tauri for vibe coding (17 points | 3 comments)
5. Qwen3: Think deeper, act faster (718 points | 311 comments)
6. Show HN: Flowcode – Turing-complete visual programming platform (62 points | 28 comments)
7. Why did Windows 7 log on slower for months if you had a solid color background? (357 points | 150 comments)
8. Programming languages should have a tree traversal primitive (6 points | 3 comments)
9. Uber raises in-office requirement to 3 days, claws back remote workers (28 points | 21 comments)
10. A single line of code cost $8000 (100 points | 95 comments)
11. Amazon to display tariff costs for consumers (239 points | 140 comments)
12. Generative AI is not replacing jobs or hurting wages at all, say economists (123 points | 152 comments)
13. After 53 years, a failed Soviet Venus spacecraft is crashing back to Earth (17 points | discuss)
14. The One-Person Framework in Practice (262 points | 102 comments)
15. Gaussian Splatting Meets ROS2 (4 points | discuss)
16. Heart disease deaths worldwide linked to chemical widely used in plastics (40 points | 5 comments)
17. Amazon Wants to Be a Satellite-Internet Powerhouse. It Has a Long Way to Go (5 points | discuss)
18. One Million Chessboards (276 points | 50 comments)
19. What Is "Induced Atmospheric Vibration"? (16 points | 2 comments)
20. Try Switching to Kagi (126 points | 109 comments)
21. Running Clojure in WASM with GraalVM (173 points | 28 comments)
22. Implement Flash Attention Back End in SGLang – Basics and KV Cache (20 points | 1 comment)
23. Manuscript of Ismail al-Jazarī's Ingenious Mechanical Devices (ca. 17th century) (68 points | 16 comments)
24. Widespread power outage in Spain and Portugal (1445 points | 1066 comments)
25. Greek Particles (1990) (47 points | 21 comments)
26. Ask HN: What are you working on? (April 2025) (333 points | 1003 comments)
27. Show HN: A pure WebGL image editor with filters, crop and perspective correction (210 points | 72 comments)
28. Show HN: Sim Studio – Open-Source Agent Workflow GUI (159 points | 51 comments)
29. Migrating away from Rust (625 points | 619 comments)
30. Show HN: Heart Rate Zones Plus – The first iOS app I developed (87 points | 73 comments)
